text: A fedora is a hat. The name of the hat comes from a play called FÃ©dora by Victorien Sardou, named after the main character. Encarta Dictionary, Microsoft Encarta Premium Suite 2004. Popular in the early 20th century, it has become a stereotype for gangsters or private investigators (PIs). They mainly come in black, sometimes with a band of coloured fabric around the rim. Some people, such as Jack Abramoff and Richard W. Lariviere, become known for wearing fedoras. ==References== Category:Hats
title: Fedora
